resources.string: " The mission of Student Volunteer Center is to provide extensive volunteer resources to Binghamton University students. We provide opportunities for community service, involvement in local/campus volunteer events, organization information, and volunteer guidance. In doing so, it is our hope that we may foster a sense of community among our club members, event participants, the student body, and the Binghamton community at large. "

"" To be recognized as an official or active member of SVC, you must complete at least 10 hours of service through SVC each semester. Active membership entitles you to voting privileges, the ability to run for a position on the SVC Executive Board, and the opportunity to plan your own volunteer events and/or service projects. If you are a general body member who is interested in planning an event or organizing a project with the support of others, please contact the SVC Eboad at svc@binghamtonsa.org, or attend one of our Sunday Eboard meetings at 7:00pm in UU103. "
"" As a member who has attended one or more events during the semester, your service hours will be documented. Please contact our secretary if you have any questions regarding your volunteer hours. "

" President Nicole Safran nsafran1@binghamton.edu
